name: Triclone Skin Tech Medium Coverage Foundation with Fermented Arnica
about: What it is:¬†A medium coverage, weightless, clean foundation with fermented arnica that helps reduce redness and protects from environmental stress...Coverage:¬†Medium..Finish:¬†Natural..Formulation:¬†Liquid..Highlighted Ingredients:.- Fermented Arnica: helps visibly reduces redness and irritation..- Intellizen 7 Complex‚Ñ¢: proprietary blend of medicinal herbs that promote healing and calming..- BioFerment 7 Complex‚Ñ¢: Proprietary blend of super antioxidants that protect the skin from stress...Ingredient Callouts: This product is vegan, gluten-free, and cruelty-free...What Else You Need to Know: Made with 20+ skincare ingredients, this proprietary formula delivers ultra-comfortable, longwear performance without compromising your skin. Its weightless, serum-like texture seamlessly blurs and smooths for a natural, luminous finish that wears all day. No slipping or caking...This product is an Allure Best of Beauty award winner...Clinical Results:¬†In a third-party study with 185 panelists, after application:.- 96% said skin looks healthier.- 96% said skin tone looks more even.- 95% said it feels weightless on skin..Clean.Clean at Sephora is our commitment to offering formulas that go beyond regulatory standards to avoid controversial ingredients without sacrificing effectiveness..

how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Shake well. .-Blend one to two pumps onto clean, moisturized skin using the Haus Labs Foundation Brush, fingertips, or a beauty sponge.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I was VERY weary of trying this product as I am with all viral products. I was looking for a foundation that is buildable up to medium coverage, skin like, and helps with dry skin as I get monthly chemical peel. I also haven't used a foundation in a few years and have been using tinted spf. I was very shocked how good it looked and it checked off all the boxes I was looking for. 11/10 recommend.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: been using this foundation since i got it and it is such a great product. Great coverage, works and lasts on my skin and doesn‚Äôt break me out.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This foundation texture/quality/wear reminds me of the Covergirl Foundation from the early 90s. Not bad, but not high end quality to justify the paying this much for it. It feels like drugstore foundation.

reviews.review_buyer_description: lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Absolutely love this foundation! This is the first foundation I‚Äôve used that doesn‚Äôt break out my skin! Perfect shade match as well!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Wanted to love this but it‚Äôs the worst foundation I‚Äôve ever used. It makes my skin look dry and cakey no matter what I do. My new neighbor is a MUA and came over to help. We don‚Äôt know if I got a bad product or if this just hates my skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brunette hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: What is the deal with this foundation? I ordered the 3 shade trial from the Haus Labs website.  The color match is great, although it is a bit complicated. I can wear either 160 or 175.  It looks beautiful when first applied, for about 15 minutes. However, this foundation literally dissappears off my face within a few hours. It's like I never had it on. Also, my skin seems to look dry. I do not have this issue with any other foundation (dior, pat mcgrath, about-face, guerlain, gucci, etc.). I have combo skin but only slightly oily in t-zone and slightly dry cheeks. I don't have a lot of texture or wrinkles. I don't wear primer, but I do wear sunscreen (Tatcha or Dr. Dennis Gross). I've tried applying with a brush and beauty blender, ensured my skincare is dry before applying, set with a little powder. I suspect that it has something to do with the triclone technology.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Olive skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I was pleasantly surprised by the Haus Labs Foundation in shade 425 Medium Deep Neutral. After struggling with other brands where the formulas or undertones didn‚Äôt match, I finally found a foundation that works for my medium tan to medium deep skin tone. The coverage is medium but buildable, giving a dewy, radiant finish that looks fresh and natural. The only issue I found is that the undertone leans a bit more red, but I was able to balance it out with the right concealer in certain areas. Overall, it‚Äôs a great match and performs well for my complexion. I have also received many compliments from wearing this foundation.  The price is a tad bit high. But I will have to stock up once their is a sale or use my points.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: best foundation I have found so far. Lightweight but buildable, so perfect for either casual makeup or an event, and has the prettiest subtle glow!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is one of the worst foundations I‚Äôve ever used. I really wanted to like it but it crusted around my mouth like I‚Äôve never seen another foundation do. It made my skin look incredibly dry no matter what type of skin prep I did.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I absolutely love this foundation, for awhile I always stuck with the huda stick foundation for years cause I felt like liquid foundations tend to feel so heavy and look extremely cakey but using this foundation it doesn‚Äôt feel heavy, it looks natural, it feels hydrating, it gives you a soft glow and blends out really nicely by itself and with other products. I tested it out during many shifts at work and my skin looked the same way it looked before I clocked in which was really great. I will say as someone who has oily skin you will look shiny by the end of the day. It‚Äôs just how it is unfortunately. With the huda stick foundation it tends to be very matte and I wasn‚Äôt so oily by the end of the day but you can tell I was wearing makeup and I feel like with this foundation it looks more natural and I‚Äôm willing to have that trade off. just bring the Fenty invisimatte powder in your purse and you‚Äôll be fine :)

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I hope they never get rid of this foundation. My skin looks flawless, and I always get complimented and how great my skin looks. It just melts into the skin but provides excellent coverage. I have rather sensitive skin and this never bothers me. Try it!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I‚Äôm on my second bottle of foundation of this! Lady Gaga did her big one with this product. If you love a natural dewy look this foundation is for you. It‚Äôs easy to build coverage and doesn‚Äôt look too cakey either.

reviews.review_text: i have dry skin so i was looking for a good foundation that would sit on my face, rather than sitting on top of my skin and drying up. this foundation has done the job and makes me feel like im wearing foundation for my sensitive skin. def recommend!

reviews.review_title: skin like finish! Light to Medium coverage
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Medium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I would call this more of a light to medium coverage - I don't find it particularly buildable - that being said, the skin like finish is unmatched. It's very soft and velvety, honestly the most skin like texture I've found in a foundation. Feels like nothing on the skin, not cakey whatsoever. I have a few acne scars and it doesn't cover them (not surprising as it's labelled medium coverage) but it evens out my skin tone beautifully and it lasts long. I would recommend! If you already have great skin, this will make it perfect!

reviews.review_title: not great for my arazlo skin :(
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: this is mostly for my arazlo/tret girlies, as i‚Äôm currently using arazlo <3 for reference i normally have combination, acne-prone skin. since starting arazlo, my skin has literallyyyy been peeling off and my makeup NEVER sits right. i tried a couple foundations and this one was alright, but not great. when i first put this on, i thought it looked sooo good on my skin, but very quickly it started to look extremely cakey. the area around my mouth (chin, upper lip) looked so terrible after only an hour of wear. most foundations do that to me, but with the haus labs it was just SO much worse than others. additionally, it wore SO weirdly on my nose? my nose pores were incredibly noticeable when i used this, and although i tried multiple different primers, nothing helped. on top of that, i found this foundation transferred like CRAZYYY. i could slightly touch my skin and the entire layer of foundation would come off, and i‚Äôve never had a foundation do that üò≠üò≠ the shade match was honestly perfect, and i can see it works for so many people, but it just wasn‚Äôt really for me. i ended up returning this and got the lanc√¥me foundation (which is so expensive, but it‚Äôs the only foundation so far that‚Äôs worked for my skin currently)

reviews.review_title: Get Loads of Compliments about my Skin!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I've been using this for a few months and it is beautiful. I get a lot of compliments when I use this foundation! I haven't been excited in a while about a foundation. It's very beautiful on the skin. IF you have normal-oily skin!  Pros: Very lightweight. A little goes a lonng way. Medium-full coverage. Makes the skin look very smooth and perfect. I feel like it has a satin skinlike finish. The color match is great. I also love that on it's own, it works great as an eyeshadow primer.   Cons: The only con I feel is that if you have dry skin, it will enhance the appearance of your dry skin. I have dry-normal skin and it's the winter so I'm more dry. I HAVE to prep my skin with some serum and day moisturizer to make sure the foundation looks smooth. Or it just looks cakey, cracked, flaky if your skin is thirsty. So if you have constant dry skin, it may not work for you if you don't feel like or have time to prep before you do your makeup.

I drove 40min as planned to end up returning all of them since none matched but the person from the store wouldn't accept the returns. I explained to her that I was just trying to color match and there were 2 that weren't even opened cause I could easily tell that I was way off with those but she still didn't accept my return. I spent so much money on them I felt bad just throwing them out until today. Biggest waste of money and the worst experience I've had at Sephora. My friends have done the same thing before with no issues. I started spending a lot less since then and now I don't care to try new things since you never know who Sephora will accept returns from. reviews.review_title: The end to my foundation search
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I‚Äôm still fairly new to makeup, but I‚Äôve established with myself that I prefer powder foundations over liquid foundations as it works better for my oily skin in the humid summer. But with cold and dry weather on its way, it‚Äôs time to switch to a liquid form foundation that could help with my dehydrated skin but still work with my oily skin. I started with the drugstore and found some okay options but nothing that satisfied my needs and made me put a hard stop on my searching. I decided to take a chance with this foundation after hearing many great things. From the first swatch in my shade matching at Sephora, I just knew this would be the one. I already loved the way it felt on my cheek. When the sephora employee found my perfect shade, I looked in the mirror and I couldn‚Äôt even tell she had swatched it, and it solidified it for me: I. LOVE. THIS. FOUNDATION! Having dehydrated skin, I just love how hydrating and nourishing the formulation feels on my skin. It doesn‚Äôt settle into my pores, accentuate my texture, or cling to dry spots. Having oily skin, it feels so lightweight and barely there and leaves a skin-like natural radiant finish. The longevity and performance of this is top notch. Even when my natural oils start to break through, the foundation stays put and together (I also don‚Äôt wear primer at all under makeup). I‚Äôm a yoga teacher, and even in my hot yoga class, sweating didn‚Äôt disturb the foundation too much. Yes, there was some transfer when I dabbed the sweat off my face with a towel, but my face still looked good and smooth. It also plays well with my powder foundations when I touch up throughout the day. All-in-all, this foundation is amazing and it‚Äôs pretty much my ‚ÄúHoly Grail‚Äù. I just started a no-buy with a goal of emptying out my current foundation products, and after wearing this foundation, I know I‚Äôll be able to stick to it and use it to the last drop. And honestly, I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll replace it with anything else at Sephora.

reviews.review_text: This foundation is fine. I found a pretty good color match and it looks fine on. It spins and spins and spins but never locks into place. Ok, no big deal. Except it is a big deal. You can't travel with it without the foundation leaking out and getting all over everything in your makeup bag. Once I tipped it over accidentally and the lid flew off and half the bottle exploded out. No makeup bottle, no matter the price, should have a bottle that can't tip over without the lid falling off and losing half the product. I cannot understand how this packaging design passed any kind of quality test. Like I said, the foundation is fine but the bottle is so terrible I would not buy this again even if it was the best foundation I have ever tried.

My skin type is normal to dry so it wasn‚Äôt oiliness causing the issue. I‚Äôll be returning it.  I also had a hard time finding a shade match. I‚Äôm between 015 and 060. It would‚Äôve been nice if there was a cool-toned (what Haus Labs labels as warm) shade between 015 and 060.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Fair skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: My skin is about as dramatic as my disposition. My t-zone is absurdly oily and my cheeks can be quite dry and flakey, which makes finding a suitable foundation nearly impossible. Stack my struggles with rosacea on top of all this and it's a recipe for disappointment. The first time I tried this product, I applied way too much and it looked unpleasantly mask-like. As it didn't cause irritation or clog my pores, I thought it might be worth some additional experimentation. When I considered that less might be more, I tried applying it with a damp sponge. Bingo! It is definitely buildable, but only to a certain point. After a few hours of wear, I do need to blot my t-zone, but the product does not separate, so it continues to look good post-blot. If your pre-foundation routine involves a lot of thick moisturizers, I can imagine this might look a little heavy. Finding the best method of application to work harmoniously with other skincare products might take a bit of experimentation, but I think it is worth it. Also, this contains no fragrance. (Thank you, thank you, thank you!) Anyone with sensitive skin will recognize my passionate feelings on this issue, I think. I love this product more every time I use it.

reviews.review_title: The most reliable foundation there is
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I know this foundation doesn't work for everyone, but I found it perfect for me. It has a good amount of coverage (medium-high) and lays beautifully on the skin. It's on the dewier side and doesn't last super long without power on my combo-oily skin. However, I found that it wears off really gracefully. Even on long days, a little bit of powder brought it back to life.   My favorite part about this foundation is how reliable it is. I use retinol in my skincare, so I often get flakey skin around my mouth and forehead. This foundation always performs beautifully, no matter the state of my skin.   Also I definitely noticed that my skin looked a lot calmer and moisturized when I wore it often, so the skincare-led formula is definitely effective.   The shades of this foundation are a little strange, but I found that 100 fits me perfectly for most of the year. It's so sad that my shade has been sold out for months, so I had to switch to a different foundation.

reviews.review_text: If you have mature skin run away. I was influenced and wanted to try out this foundation on my mature skin. My normal go to‚Äôs are IT CC cream, and Georgio Armani. I skin prepped with my normal routine, wash, exfoliate, toner, serum, moisturizer w sunscreen, then primer. I make sure that my skin prep is water based to match the foundation. After everything is absorbed into my skin I put this on with high hopes. I have combo and mature skin and right out of the gate it stuck to every imperfection. Lines were enhanced and somehow on my highly prepped skin it still manages to give me patchy dry spots. When I saw the udder disaster that was happening I thought maybe I had messed up the pregame steps. Since my makeup was already ruined at this point and I would leave my house with it on I did the other half of my face with my IT CC cream just to see if we had the same outcome on the other side. Nope, my normal foundation went on like a dream. So why did I buy this if I have 2 amazing foundations that I wear on the regular? Everyone had hyped this up so much I figured it must really be worth it, and it was slightly cheaper than my GA foundation so maybe it would save me money in the long run. Nope, I tried it twice ( I will give everything a fair shot) and the outcome both times managed to make my skin look older, dryer and just gross.

reviews.review_title: Beautiful finish but difficult to apply
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: It took forever to figure out how to make this foundation work, but once I did it looked amazing. So I'm passing along what worked for me:   Normal skin prep, Milk hydro grip primer, and either a large fluffy concealer brush or a small fluffy foundation brush. Starting with a few drops on the back of your hand, load your brush, then swirl and press into your skin (press into skin on areas that need more coverage, like around the nose or where you see brush strokes). Then, if you need more coverage, repeat this process.  Set with with a little bit of powder and finish with setting spray (I used Milk hydro grip setting spray or Kryolan fixing spray).  When I applied using this technique, it stayed pretty much all day with minimal touch-ups.   The trick was applying in thin layers.  When I tried to apply it in a single layer (like a typical foundation) or used a beauty blender to apply it, it looked like hot garbage (patchy, separated, and cakey)   Also, if your skin is sensitive to silicone ingredients, get a sample first.  The silicone in this caused my skin to break out.

For this foundation to apply and LOOK GREAT it‚Äôs even more important than usual to make sure EVERY product used underneath is water based or it will just sit in every crevice and pore. But once you get your routine down let me just say that it‚Äôs stunning!! I have never had a foundation like it. My makeup seems to look even better as the day progresses. It definitely lives up to all the hype.  It gets an A+++ from me!! A 10/10!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I want so badly to like this foundation base don all the reviews but I may be part of the minority when I say I don't love it.  Color matching is darn near impossible -- I would NOT recommend trying to do this online, because the descriptions of the colors vs the actual in-person colors are very different. I've heard this from other people & influencers who say their undertones are different from other brands (meaning, cool is actually warm, warm is actually cool, and neutral is...a total shot in the dark). I don't understand the reasoning behind this, as it makes color matching extraordinarily tough and more trouble than it's worth.  I am pretty fair/light with neutral undertones that can pull a little more cool, push comes to shove. I ended up with the shade 110, which is supposed to be neutral, but every time I put it on I think wow that looks yellow. But hey, I can make it work...or so I thought.  This always ends up looking cake on me and never really settles into my skin. I've done a total overhaul of my skin prep to include fewer products (one serum and a sunscreen) to allow the foundation to melt into my skin, but it just never looks right. It doesn't build, it always looks patchy in areas, and I find myself washing my face a couple hours after I put it on because it just looks bad.  That said, I LOVE the extensive shade range, and the finish is really pretty - natural satin, but finding a color that works for me has been such a frustrating experience (I swatched probably 7 shades in store, none of them really right), and I don't think my skin likes this. Everyone is different, and different things work for different people, but I have not had luck with this

reviews.review_text: There‚Äôs so much to love about this product, but so much to hate unfortunately ü•≤. First, I will say, the application is beautiful if you have the right skin for it. Although it is a skin like finish, the foundation itself is thick, sludgy almost, you notice this significantly when cleaning your makeup brushes or sponge and squeeze out the thick film like residue it leaves.  But a little product goes a long way, one bottle will last me around two months. You must shake the bottle each time before use or by the end you‚Äôll end up with a weird separated version of the formula.   I started cycling retinol into my routine and my skin is no longer compatible with this formula unfortunately. Clung to dry patches like crazy and I felt even aided in the dryness of my skin. Another thing to note is this foundation oxidizes like crazy. Took a few purchases to find my right color but the match was pretty spot on.  The last and final thing is the TRANSFER. Even with a primer, high end setting powder and setting spray this foundation transferred like nothing I‚Äôve ever used. I almost gave up wearing white clothes completely because I would always somehow have a transfer on my neckline and random fingerprints all over my clothes and belongings from resting my chin on my hand or touching my face, even in the slightest bit. This is the main reason I won‚Äôt be repurchasing ü•≤

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This is one of the most natural skin like foundations in the clean category - BUT the brand has done a terrible job of giving instructions + the brushes they sell for this aren‚Äôt the best ones to apply it. Also, you need good, gently exfoliated skin that has a MEDIUM (not high) level of moisture on it. How to apply to get her great results & look like you‚Äôre not wearing anything: 1. Regular, gentle chemical exfoliation. 2. Mist face with water/ rose water 3. Press oil or moisturizer in gently (don‚Äôt make it too oily) 4. Wait a couple of mins for it to absorb so skin feels comfortable but not dewy or oily to the touch. Not too dry not too moisturized - better to be a bit more dry than dewy 5. Don‚Äôt stiple, BUFF a tiny amount on your face, using circular motions (imagine you‚Äôre trying to polish your face with the brush). Don‚Äôt use a lot at once, use drop by drop, build it up slowly. Use a flat top buffing brush, the kind you use for bare minerals or mineral foundations or powder mineral foundation. Flat bristles are essential to buffing. Buff as much as possible. If you don‚Äôt buff and build slowly every shade in this line (I‚Äôve tried several shades) will oxidize / turn warm or orange. The line leans warm (and their definition of warm and cool and peach is their own / doesn‚Äôt make sense to me). Choose something that is cooler toned than you normally would or mix a bit of blue or cool toned blush in to correct (if non returnable). DO NOT use primer especially silicon ones (you WILL become orange). Treat this like a mineral foundation and it will give you great results - SKIN like results, no makeup makeup results

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I just recently started wearing makeup. As a man, I frequently get razor bumps on my beard whenever I shave, and I was looking for something to help cover up the redness and even out my complexion. As a makeup beginner, I tried out some drug store brands and each one I tried just seemed too pigmented, and made it look very obvious that I was wearing makeup, which was not my goal. Since discovering Haus Labs Triclone Skin Tech Foundation, I have never bought another brand since. It blends into my skin like butter, and I don't even feel like I'm wearing anything on my face. I have gotten NUMEROUS compliments from people and once I tell them I'm wearing Haus Labs, they almost always respond with I can't even tell you're wearing makeup (which is my goal!). As a man who's just looking to even out my complexion and hide imperfections, this is the perfect, natural-looking product. Also, the dewy finish it leaves behind is an added bonus!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I'm not a huge foundation girl - I typically go for skin tints because I like a lighter coverage, but the Haus Labs foundation has totally converted me. I love that it has so many skincare ingredients, and feels lightweight yet provides good, buildable coverage. Definitely will be my go to foundation from now on!

reviews.review_title: Great find, lightweight but solid coverage
reviews.review_text: The foundation packaging boasts an elegant aesthetic. My initial impression suggests a product that values both form and function. In terms of performance, the foundation provides decent coverage, effectively balancing out skin tone and concealing imperfections. I was surprised at how surprisingly lightweight it felt, offering a feel that's more substantial than sheer but without the heaviness often associated with full-coverage foundations. It didn‚Äôt feel like I was wearing makeup. Texture-wise, the foundation scores points for not being sticky or oily, a plus for those seeking a comfortable, non shiny finish throughout the day.  The process of online color matching turned out to be quite effective, resulting in a shade that closely matched my skin tone. This accuracy in digital color selection is commendable and shows that the brand has invested in making sure customers can find their right match remotely.  On the downside, the packaging, although visually appealing, falls short in practicality. The lack of an applicator tip was my only notable drawback. The current stick design can lead to dripping, which is not ideal for those who need to apply their makeup quickly or while on the move. This aspect of the design could be improved to enhance the overall user experience.  Disclosure that I received the Haus labs foundation in exchange for an honest review.

Plus, its unique formula ensures that it never looks or feels cakey on the skin, giving you a natural-looking finish that lasts all day long.

reviews.review_text: I gotta say I saw this foundation for months....and kept seeing the reviews saying it's slick and well of course not matte, but I only like matte foundation, I like too look airbrushed too. I used a lil setting powder to matte it down and I looked flawless. I am in love !!!! I never looked so perfect skinned in my life, I get hives and redness from stress and it completely covered it up! With very lil product. I didn't look cakey and it never moved at all from my face. I highly recommend this foundation. if I could give 100 stars I would. Giving away my fenty beauty foundation and ordering a back up of this foundation. the packaging feels very luxurious and expensive. the glass bottle is so butterfly soft. Don't hesitate and order! You won't regret. I regret not ordering sooner....

I have combination, super acne prone skin with a lot of hyperpigmentation and texture. Therefore when I wear makeup I want it to cover everything. I have used Fenty and Georgio Armani and they both ended up being cakey when I tried to build or achieve the coverage I desired. I put this foundation on today and worked a 7.5 hour serving shift and my makeup looked great before and after. I felt that it didn‚Äôt accentuate my texture and it went really well with my nars concealer to get the full coverage look without the cakey-ness. I have seen some reviews that the foundation doesn‚Äôt dry down and they aren‚Äôt completely wrong. I struggled with getting it to fully dry down but when I used setting powder (elf halo glow or Fenty powder) it settled and was dry enough that I felt good about layering other products. I have only wore it once so I am unsure how it will impact my acne but I have a good feeling so far. I would definitely recommend giving this foundation a try especially for my acne girlies or guys

reviews.review_text: I like this a lot. It's a perfect shade match. Not at all ashy and the right undertones. I can't give it a perfect rating because it doesn't dry down after hours on my skin. I put Shiseido on half my face and this on the other half and the Shiseido side is dry, albeit the wrong shade for me.   Also this is a slightly sheerer coverage than I would like. I could probably build it up, but would rather not have to, particularly since even one layer doesn't dry. Every time I touch my face some color comes away on my fingertips. And all I have under this is sunblock, no moisturizer, concealer, etc. and it still won't dry down.  That said, I'm not wearing any makeup in this photo other than the foundation and some lip gloss. I'm 57, so I consider this to be a good foundation to be able to achieve this look on its own.   The shade 385 is a perfect match for my skin color though and I will definitely keep this, though my search for the perfect foundation is not over yet.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Gray eyes, blonde hair, Porcelain skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: A few warnings with this one because  a learning curve was necessary in order to wear it, still 5 stars!  This is unlike any foundation I've ever worn, including the colors being atypical of what I buy. As a VERY fair skinned person, I'm used to being cool but it turned out for this brand I am neutral. Also, this cannot be applied in strokes with a brush or fingers. The foundation sticks well to texture and putting it on in this way makes it look very ugly and it breaks all over the place. However, it goes on like a DREAM with a wet sponge--the skin looks glowy and soft, and it looks just like perfected skin. when setting it and giving it a spritz with a face mist, the glass skin technique can be achieved too.  I will say that this is one of the few foundations that leaves me looking forward to seeing my skin after I take it off too. My skin is healthier than before, with limited redness and even texture after wearing this foundation for two weeks. It is well worth it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: So I have worn this foundation 3-4 times now and it took me a couple of uses to solidify how I feel about it. This really mimics your skin, but that means if your skin is really oily or dry, it‚Äôll emphasize that. The first application, I applied it with my fingers and it looked like it wasn‚Äôt really becoming one with my skin. It was emphazising my texture and didn‚Äôt really look glowy or dewy and wasn‚Äôt as natural of a finish as I was expecting. I tried using it again with a beauty sponge and it did the same thing, not really sinking in and melting into the skin‚Ä¶ so the next time I tried it, I decided to really play around with skin prep. I used my regular essence and moisturizer, but added glowy serum and doubled up my moisturizer so my face was tacky and dewy. This went on like a dream! So flawless and seamless and skin like, and wore all night. My skin looks incredible but only if I layer the right hydrating products. Otherwise, it looks almost matte on my skin. I took one star off because I feel like it should make skin naturally dewy and skin like without having to layer serums and creams, but the way it performs with the right skin prep has made me reconsider exchanging it. I‚Äôve decided to keep it as I love the packaging and I love the texture and weightlessness of the formula! Just ensure you have the right skin prep for your skin type and the finish you are trying to achieve.

reviews.review_text: I‚Äôve been using this foundation non-stop for the last month and I‚Äôm very confident in naming it as my Holy Grail foundation. I find this to be a slightly thicker alternative to the Armani Luminous silk (my other HG) with fuller coverage and longer staying power. 260 light medium cool Is a perfect match to the luminous silk shade 6 which is a light-medium/medium golden shade with olive undertones.  An online beauty assistant originally shade matched me to something way too neutral, and I knew I should‚Äôve just went with my gut and ordered 260.  This foundation blends with ease, whether I use a brush or beauty blender, but I prefer the latter. It does a nice job of covering up blemishes on its own, so I rarely have to spot conceal. It lasts a full work day and more on my oily/combo skin and never gets too shiny or patchy. The general finish is natural with a slight glow (on me).  I do pair this with the Haus Labs concealer and they blend seamlessly together. I am so so pleased with this foundation! I use it everyday for work and special occasions. The only con I have is that the glass bottle is very heavy (but very luxe).

reviews.review_title: Perfect Medium Shade for Golden Peach Undertones
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Olive skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: For years, I've struggled to match a foundation shade perfectly; my first 27 years living in the Philippines where colorism favors lighter skin have given me no foundation option other than a variation of light pinks and yellows that made me look like a ghost. Moving to the US and having access to darker shades made me think it would be easier to find a great shade match, but even after 2 years the warm shades would always be too yellow/orange on my face, and neutral shades would always register olive and grey against my skin. While finding the right shade in Haus Labs was a struggle in itself, when I did, it was nothing short of a miracle. I found out that I had a golden undertone, but with peach mixed in (HL follows MAC undertone labelling: cool is warm, warm is cool), and when my test swatch melted onto my skin, it was such a great feeling.  I have been using this foundation since I got it, and it blends seamlessly onto my face. I do have an oily face and have to touch up here and there, but nothing too drastic. The finish is a dewy second-skin and is great for winter. It is lightweight and doesn't leave my skin feeling dry or gross. A little goes a long way; one and a half pumps were more than enough to even out my skintone. No separation observed so far, but I do set it with the Givenchy Prisme Libre or Makeup Forever HD Setting Powder throughout the day. Needless to say, this is my favorite foundation thus far based on shade match and formula. Don't hesitate to give this a try!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Okay here‚Äôs the run up  I have SUCH a hard time believing reviews and weeding through fake ones, ones where the product was sent to the customer, ones that are ‚Äúpaid‚Äù etc;  I never usually write reviews but for something that‚Äôs a staple like foundation I figured an honest review from someone who paid for this product themselves with their hard earned money could help someone :)   1. this product blew my socks off. I have pretty clear skin with some closed comodones, texture, redness etc; this covers up ALL of that with one pump and leaves my skin looking so supple and soft. Literally skin like. Idk if they put crack in this stuff because I haven‚Äôt ever found a foundation that makes my skin look flawless but like im wearing nothing. Definitely a great medium.  2. I take my skincare very seriously and I found that freshly washing my skin before hand gives me the best results and truly shows off the potential of this foundation. I understand this isn‚Äôt convenient or always possible, but I‚Äôve used it without and it still looks great but skincare is important as a base for any foundation so take that as you will :)  3. My holy grail pair as a base for this foundation is the Bobbi brown vitamin C moisturizer. Yes I know. It‚Äôs tragic and utterly said a bottle of that stuff is 100 dollars but I think ANY hydrating moisturizer would make this foundation gleam!  4. My skin type is dry with some oiliness on my nose and forehead, the wear on this stuff is amazing I don‚Äôt find myself feeling like a puddle of oil throughout the day. It wear soooo beautifully  5. I wore this to my nursing graduation and it photographed beautifully, it looked like I had a filter on my skin  Overall, this is my HG foundation and nothing else on the market had matched up to it for me. I‚Äôve tried everything from NARS radiant and Luminous silk, to elf and L‚ÄôOr√©al. Literally almost everything. This took the cake for me :) if the bad reviews still put you off, Sephora gives free samples, it won‚Äôt hurt

reviews.review_text: Oh my gosh is this foundation terrible. I had influenced by social media to buy this because many people had said that this foundation is good for dry skin. It was not. My face had never looked more dry and cracked; it literally gave me wrinkles I didn't know I had. Absolutely no hydration in this product. reviews.review_title: NOT for dry or textured skin
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I wanted SO badly to love this foundation. So many raves about it from people online and I loved how it looked in tutorials. I have very dry skin but keep it hydrated and moisturized prior to makeup application. I tried applying with brush the first time and Haus Labs accentuated every single line, texture and pore on my face. I tried it a second time with just my fingers and same thing. It separated minutes after application. I was also not a fan of how thick but also runny it felt. If you have dry skin or any lines or texture at all DO NOT use this product!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I don‚Äôt write reviews often but felt this would be useful to those considering a purchase. For reference, I used to be a makeup junkie and am very well versed in application, skin care, etc. As I‚Äôve aged, had children , and grown to  Understand what suits me, I‚Äôve realized that I don‚Äôt appreciate the look of a full face of makeup. Although my skin is not nearly as flawless as it was in my early 20s , it‚Äôs not that bad either- but I do suffer from rosacea flare ups around my cheeks which is the main purpose for my foundation. I got hooked on the Chanel le beige aqua fresh water skin tint because it‚Äôs both a skin care and a lightweight foundation and doesn‚Äôt feel (or look) at all like you are wearing makeup.   I purchased the haus labs foundation for a night out and because a Sephora rep highly recommended it.  Anyways, almost immediately upon application, I removed the foundation as I felt it was extremely heavy and looked like a mask - exactly what I try to avoid with makeup. I‚Äôve also watched YouTube and TikTok videos of people applying the foundation and I have to say I‚Äôve seen many cases where they look better before the foundation.  With that being said, I think this is probably a very good formula for people who want a full face of makeup that will cover all imperfections. For me, I just feel that it looks way too heavy and unnatural and not at all like real skin ( for me). This could be because as I said, I‚Äôve grown to appreciate the look of a little bit of skin imperfection shining through. I returned this foundation and will instead opt for the Armani luminous foundation if I want a bit more coverage but still want to look natural.   So- to sum up, if you‚Äôre someone that does not like even a bit of heavy foundation, i would say skip this product and opt for either the Chanel le beige or the Armani luminous silk (worth the price). If you love a full face of makeup- you‚Äôll probably like this.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have always had trouble finding foundation that is right for my skin tone. My foundation was either a shade too dark or light, and tended to oxidize.I had settled for good enough foundation til I found Haus Labs! I followed their shade selector on the website and was skeptical, but when I received this foundation, it was amazing! The match is perfect and looks totally natural. I was worried as it looked like the formula went on very thinly and I didn't know if I'd have enough coverage- it's deceiving ,because while it's light weight, the coverage is fantastic and looks very natural. I also have sensitive skin and tend to break out from some foundations, this one is actually making my skin look better all around, likely thanks to the Arnica. One bottle also lasts quite a while. HIGHLY recommend!

reviews.review_title: Skin-like finish & great in 90¬∞F humid weather
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Love love love this foundation, I had to buy it in a darker shade when I got tanner!  When I first bought this foundation, I had the most perfect shade match which made me realize that I don't have warm undertones after all (unfortunately, my closest shade match for this foundation while I have a tan has warm undertones [which is labeled as cool in Haus Labs for some reason] so I have to blend it with a blue concealer).  I used this foundation when I had my professional headshots taken and for my graduation photoshoot, which gave me a beautiful glow in my photos. I also took this foundation on vacation to the Philippines during May/June where the weather was humid and was averaging 90¬∞F without feeling like my face will melt off. I'm unsure how this foundation performs without primer, but I used the Elf Power Grip Primer. I am not a fan of low coverage foundation so I appreciate how this has a buildable, medium to high coverage. I also love how this foundation has a skin-like finish. If you want it to look more matte, you can always put on more powder.  I'm not really a fan of trying new foundations once I've found one I already like, but I'm glad to have tried this foundation, which has now become my new favorite.

reviews.review_title: I would give this 100 stars if I could!!!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I'm a makeup junkie and have at any one time about 6 foundations to choose from. I am about to throw all the others away; my Shiseido, Estee Lauder, Mario, Clinique, Ilia and stick with this because absolutely nothing looks as good!  I don't know what Lady Gaga has done, but this is the creamiest, radiant, buildable, most skin like foundation I have ever used.  I got color matched at Sephora because after summer vacation, even with 50 SPF and all the sun protection I could wear, I still was a bit tan.  The color match now is a little off after being home for 3 months, but it doesn't matter a bit.  It blends in, doesn't oxidize or move around, get patchy or anything.  I am so thrilled with this one that unless it changes, this is it for me.  I may go lighter as Winter progresses but it seems to be somewhat self adjusting so I many not need to.  It give great coverage too but you don't need to pile it on.  Two thin layers do the trick.  I set it with setting spray and it lasts until just about bedtime.  Highly recommend.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, red hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: For reference I‚Äôm a redhead with fair skin and freckles which pushes me into neutral shade match territory. This review will compare a few products in shades light-neutral: In the photo on top: shade 100 in haus middle, 20n tarte Amazonian clay bottom, top super goop glow sunscreen in Sunset. All are supposed to be light neutral.  So for haus, the sample bottle is super cute - it looks like a little mini bottle of yellow paint. That would be great if I had yellow undertones but 100 is supposed to be light neutral. Why is it so hard for brands to create a true neutral that doesn‚Äôt lean pink yellow, orange or grey?  And I used my points for this! It‚Äôs disappointing in color match but I could get over that and find another shade if I liked the formula. I don‚Äôt. It is very oily and kinda greasy feeling and sits in my pores instead of blending in and smoothing. It‚Äôs kinda a gluey formula on the skin- it doesn‚Äôt cover, doesn‚Äôt plump and doesn‚Äôt give a nice glowy look. ( Comparing all three, so far even though it‚Äôs a tiny bit on orange, I like the super goop glow serum in sunset the best - because the formula covers and evens tone and smooths it all out  without sitting on top of every imperfection, add to that a little healthy subtle glow,  and it‚Äôs a win. Reminder it‚Äôs not a foundation so it‚Äôs a thinner coverage but easier to blend and just throw on and go)

reviews.review_text: It's a beautiful foundation on me, but every shade is a bit too saturated for my skins undertones. It works best for me when I don't use any primer and moisturize my face with a nice gel moisturizer (the belif one is good for this).

It lasts all day on my skin and never looked cracky or oily. I‚Äôm still testing it out but so far I‚Äôm loving it.

reviews.review_text: I really wanted to LOVE this (love Lady Gagaü•∞)  I have two major concerns with this foundation.  Starting with the positive, I like the smoothness of this product very much.  It feels weightless on the skin, blends easy, and is buildable to a fuller coverage.  The two main disadvantages for me: 1) I have dry skin, and at 58 this product settles into fine lines quite quickly.  I tried it for a full week, I applied serums, primers and moisturizers to no avail. 2)  Although there is quite a shade selection, I do not feel there is enough of an accurate representation of shades for us pink undertone gals. When you look at the shade selection online, it doesn‚Äôt come close to the color you receive in the bottle. :(  Even the shade fair cool was more on the ‚Äúyellow‚Äù spectrum.  I also tried blending it with some other foundations and color corrector.  It just wasn‚Äôt for me.  I would love to try it again if there were more shades within slightly more pink undertones.  Also, if consideration were given to mature skin gals as well.

It really makes me disappointed because the color was so spot-on to start with. It looks so beautiful like my skin but slightly better. I think if you have more normal to combination skin this would be perfect for you If you're looking for something to just take away a little bit of the redness And you like a sheer coverage.

reviews.review_text: I've worn this foundation every day for the past week and I can't stand it. Honestly one of *the worst* foundations I've ever used. First day, tried it on it's own with a primer. Applies smoothly, looks ok after immediate application. But within a half hour, it settled into every nook and cranny it could find on my face, even in places foundation doesn't normally settle! After 8 hours of wear, it looked ready to fall off my face on it's own. The next few days, I tried it again with other primers and setting powders, but even with powder, it's just terrible. My skin isn't even oily, nor is it dry! Going back to Charlotte Tilbury... or just make my own.

reviews.review_title: Strange Tint, super dry and unnatural
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I read reviews that stated this looked natural and that they had found the perfect shade match.  When I looked at the pictures all of them seemed to have a strange tint, their undertones were poorly matched and they appeared to have way too much foundation on.  Assuming this was user error, I purchased 3 shades trying to find a perfect match.  The shades run dark.  No matter what shade or undertone I selected- it gave me a weird sickly tint just like the other photos.  I am normally light and have a warm undertone.  I match rare beauty tinted moisturizer in shade 24N and Dynessa myricks shade 4 in tinted moisturizer.  Shade 160 was very yellow, shade 175 was dark and orange and shade 120 was almost cool toned but also orange.  Every shade I tried looked super unnatural despite only using a tiny amount.  It was also very dry and matte on me.  My fave looked weird and sickly just like 99% of the review photos.  I went into store and tried a few other shades.  This is one of the worst looking foundations I have ever tried.  Because of the skin care ingredients and it‚Äôs promise to ‚Äúcalm‚Äù skin I was desperate to make it work, but don‚Äôt believe the hype- it‚Äôs gross.

I can honestly say this is the worst foundation I've tried in a very long time. I'm returning it. Don't be fooled by the influencers who rave about this.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, gray hair, Tan skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Wow!! The color matching system was waayyy off. I went into the store and matched myself. It was so worth it. This shade was perfect for the center of my face which has a red undertone and is lighter (warm for this line) and purchased 385 medium neutral for the perimeter of my face which is a bit browner with more of a yellow undertone. Wow! I don't care that I purchased two bottles even though I could have made it work with one. This foundation is worth it because I will never again have to buy foundations that I either give away or sit looking fancy in my drawer. This is it! I am 60 years old and it definitely looks like my skin but better. This is my first review of any product. I just usually spend the money and deal with it. For reference, I use Nars Caracas on the perimeter and Dior 4.5N in the center of my face. It works - mostly I guess. Haus Labs is it! Oh - and this is important - Don't use too much. It really is a dab will do you product. So, if you are like me and have to mix colors - you will have them forever. Lovely, lovely product. I should feel a bit sad for the other makeup companies but somehow I just don't. Haus Labs has hit it out of the ballpark and has changed the game. My skin with foundation looks lovely. Thank you

reviews.review_title: I actually really loved it for my skin
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I‚Äôve been hearing so much about this foundation (sometimes amazing, sometimes not) but I‚Äôm so glad I finally decided to try it! This is hands down, no questions, my favorite foundation of all time! It‚Äôs a super thin formula that legitimately feels like a soothing serum on your skin. I thought the coverage would be too sheer because of this but it‚Äôs not‚Ä¶it‚Äôs a true medium buildable coverage. I have a good amount of sunspots and pigmentation to cover and it truly covers it. You can sheer it out some and let your freckles peek through though too. It‚Äôs hydrating but also blurring at the same time, which is really hard to come by. Sephora has it listed as ‚ÄúNatural Finish‚Äù and I think that‚Äôs pretty accurate, although I would really call it an ‚Äúafter spa finish.‚Äù Lol. It probably depends on your skincare and skin type but on me (normal/dry skin from tretinoin) it‚Äôs a natural leaning dewy finish but it does set down and still stays a little luminous, which I love. It also lasts all day on me. I set it with either the Hourglass or Huda loose powder or the Kosas Cloud set. My favorite thing about it is that it is COMPLETELY undetectable on my skin yet still covers everything I want and blurs my pores and fine lines! It‚Äôs truly everything I‚Äôve always wanted in a foundation. I‚Äôve seriously tried a million foundations too because I‚Äôve always been searching for that holy grail‚Ä¶I finally found it. Plus it‚Äôs cruelty free and vegan! Oh and if you‚Äôre looking for your shade online I would do the shade finder on the Haus Labs website. Don‚Äôt go by the Sephora shade finder cause it would have been soooo wrong if I listened to that‚Ä¶the Haus Labs was dead on. The shades do seem to run a little darker than you might think and the undertones are super whacky if you‚Äôre not going with a neutral shade (cool is warm and warm is cool) so if you can go in to the store it might be helpful. I was matched on Haus Labs to 110 and it‚Äôs perfect though.

I honestly think I like my bare skin better than this, and that‚Äôs coming from someone who doesn‚Äôt have even color. I tried to see if maybe exfoliating right before my makeup routine would help, but no luck at all.  2. Smudges easily. I get easily frustrated with this and haven‚Äôt found a primer or setting solution that helps get rid of the issue with this foundation.  3. Feels unpleasant. You know how there are some foundations you put on on forget it‚Äôs there? This is not one of those. I don‚Äôt know if maybe it‚Äôs a personal skin sensitivity, but I can tell I have this foundation on all day and it leaves me feeling more uncomfortable than I‚Äôd prefer.   I‚Äôm glad I gave it a try, but the formula is just not for me. Nor is it really what I expected from the description and all of the reviews. I've looked for more information about how fermented arnica is made but Haus Labs seems to be the first company to use this ingredient and there is barely any info on it. So basically, if you're acne prone, this foundation isn't clean despite the label and just be careful

It wears better the longer it is worn. And the added skincare benefits only emphasize my love for this foundation. Definitely a contender for best foundation of the year. The hype is real.

reviews.review_text: The Triclone Skin Tech Foundation in shade 110 Light Neutral has truly become my go-to choice for achieving a flawless complexion. While the Triclone Skin Tech Concealer matched to my foundation shade and the Triclone Skin Tech Concealer for brightening have become my little secret weapons that have transformed my makeup routine. The moment I apply them, I witness an instant and remarkable lift to my under-eye area. It erases signs of fatigue, dark circles, and uneven tones, leaving me with an awakened, refreshed look. What truly impresses me is its ability to brighten without settling into fine lines - a must-have for a bright, youthful appearance. With its impressive coverage and staying power, I can confidently conceal imperfections while achieving that radiant glow. The shade range offers the perfect match for my skin, ensuring a harmonious blend. These concealers have truly become my secret to flawless, luminous skin. The Haus Labs Concealer Brush has elevated my makeup application to a whole new level. Its sleek design and precise bristle arrangement make concealer application a breeze. This brush allows me to blend seamlessly, achieving a flawless, airbrushed finish. What I appreciate most is its durability and easy maintenance. It's a vital tool in my collection, ensuring my makeup looks impeccably polished every time. The Triclone Skin Tech Foundation, Triclone Concealers and Haus Labs Foundation Brush have become indispensable components of my beauty routine. Their quality, performance, and ability to deliver stunning results make them worth every penny. If you're in search of a radiant, flawless complexion these products are for you.

I did the quiz on their website to match my shade, and I really appreciated that it not only asked about my skin tone/type, but what I wanted the foundation to do and my skin concerns. I am 45 and have combination skin. I was worried it wouldn't be enough coverage, but it is more than enough, controls shine, but still looks radiant and natural. I get so many compliments! I'm glad I took the shade matching quiz as the one I originally chose was off.,,make sure you do that if you have any doubt! A little of this goes a long way, I also use my beautyblender so I use less and get natural coverage. Worth the award winning reputation!

Haus labs bases their undertones on a real color wheel so keep that in mind while selecting your undertone, I did add a touch of the 350 cool shade just to make it 100% perfect since it seems I'm in between but as you can see, the result is perfection! This foundation is great for dry skin, I think it's because of its skin loving ingredients, I still prepped my skin just because it is my ritual. The formula is lightweight, literally couldn't feel I was wearing anything. The coverage is indeed medium, you can build it up or make it even lighter by using a beauty blender (perfect for the no makeup makeup days). It never settled on my fine lines, and, as you can see in pics, it didn't emphasize my texture and it wore nicely. I suggest to set it with a powder which meets your skin's needs. Didn't have any kind of breakouts after wearing it! if you like having a foundation that not only makes you feel good and that Nourishes your skin, this is it

reviews.review_title: This foundation covers my freckles and dark spots!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: **I was gifted a Triclone Skin Tech Concealer, Triclone Skin Tech Foundation, and concealer brush for an honest review** I‚Äôve been wearing concealer since I was in 6th grade and would sneak it to school, go into the bathroom and put it on since my mom wouldn‚Äôt let me wear makeup. I have always had under eye circles and freckles which I have always been self conscious about. I‚Äôve used every concealer from drug store brands to high end brands and I have to say Triclone Skin Tech concealer (01 Fair Neutral) is in the top 3 of my favorites. I love the applicator with it and the container is made so that you don‚Äôt get too much product each time. It is a thicker formula and goes on smoothly. The concealer brush is a must have as well! It is so soft and perfectly shaped (like a finger) to get in the hard to reach places (corner of eyes) and blends perfectly. It does not absorb a lot of the product either!  The Triclone Skin Tech Foundation (040 Fair Neutral) is a medium coverage but it is buildable. My go to foundation is full coverage (because of my freckles/dark spots). I used 3-4 pumps of the foundation and that was enough to conceal the majority of my freckles/dark spots! I have the foundation brush in my collection and love it as well. It is just the larger version of the concealer brush, very soft, designed great, and doesn‚Äôt absorb tons of the product! I would definitely recommend the concealer, foundation, and BOTH brushes!

reviews.review_text: This review is going to cover the FOUNDATION.   Foundation: 300 medium neutral   *i was gifted these products for my honest review  So I've been holding off on posting my review because i wanted to test out the skin care properties that these products profess to have and I'm so glad i did! For the past 3 weeks 5-6 days a week, I've been wearing these products for 9-14hours a day and i can honestly say that I've seen such an improvement to my skin.   I have eczema patches around my mouth and eyes which makes wearing products for extended periods of time difficult because it tends to start cracking and looking caking within the first 1-2hours. This is absolutely NOT the case with these products.   The foundation wears almost like a BB cream, you can go as sheer or as heavy as you'd like since it's so buildable. I chose to wear it very sheer most days but had a few days where i went heavier because i had speaking engagements at work and was going to be on camera. Very minimal cracking, it never felt cakey, and lasted ALL day long through many busy days. I'm not a huge fan of the pump but it's not a deal breaker for me.

reviews.review_text: I was gifted this product by Haus Labs in exchange for my honest review.   I was so excited to try this stuff knowing there is skin care ingredients in it and was actually good for my skin. I have combination skin‚Äî it gets very oily and also very dry so foundation has always been a struggle‚Ä¶ but let me tell you‚Ä¶ I LOVE this stuff. It looks so natural on and is not cakey at all. My favorite part is that I can wear it all day and night and it still feels like I don‚Äôt have any makeup on (normally I am dying to go home and wash my face after a couple hours of wearing a foundation). It still looks amazing after wearing it for hours as well. I love that it‚Äôs medium-buildable coverage so it is light and natural looking, but if you want great coverage you still have it!!!  One thing I have learned after trying different methods to apply it is that with my combination skin, it only looks smooth and non splotchy if I apply it with a brush and my skin is properly prepped (face is washed then moisturized). I have tried applying using my hands or a damp beauty sponge but it didn‚Äôt blend in with my skin as nice as using a brush. I also tried using my favorite primers but I found that it actually works better without a primer as long as your skin is freshly clean and moisturized.   I recommend this product to all my foundation-wearing friends and will continue to recommend to them. Once you try this stuff you won‚Äôt be able to use another foundation again!!!

reviews.review_title: Good option between a BB Creme and Full Coverage

reviews.review_text: This is a great foundation, although it might not be ideal for super oily skin. I have mixed feelings about foundation as a make-up product overall. I feel that sometimes foundation is too much for my face and it makes me feel old. In the past I have consistently used Tarte Shape Tape Foundation, as well as Clinique Perfecting Foundation + Concealer.I will base my review as someone who has used the two mentioned foundations. I am now looking for products closer to a BB cream or lighter texture and I think this foundation is a great option for what I am currently looking for in the market. I feel that this makeup is a good middle ground for anyone looking for something that is full coverage but not cakey and is easy to blend. The way this foundation dries on your face is VERY smooth and gives you an airbrushed feeling. I did use my fingers while applying this product which I think really helped blend the foundation. This product is definitely worth the purchase. If you are on the fence I would try to go to Sephora and try to sample/test the foundation. I personally used the shade finder on Haus Labs website and the foundation that I selected after doing the foundation test was pretty accurate once I received the product and tried it on. If your skin tends to be dry as mine can sometimes be when applying all over makeup/foundation I would recommend a moisturizing primer with this foundation as I found this to not necessarily dry out my face but caused a slight dryness that was slightly itchy. I will most likely purchase this foundation again.

reviews.review_text: I‚Äôve been using this foundation ever since it came out last year and I can safely say at this point that it‚Äôs become my holy grail foundation formula. I‚Äôve been gifted my latest bottle of this foundation by Haus Labs but this review is not biased in any way. For reference, I have oily skin.   The formula is very light and serum-like. After applied, it feels weightless on the skin. It literally looks like my skin but better with just the right amount of coverage. I wear it everyday to work and it looks like my skin but better (and it lasts too!!). The key to perfect skin with this formula is to prime the skin with a silicone-based primer. It goes on incredibly smooth this way with no separation. This foundation is silicone-based so it makes sense.   On top of this being such a radiant, lightweight, and skin-like formula, it contains an array of skincare ingredients that I feel good about putting on my skin. I put this on every day so it‚Äôs gratifying to know that the foundation I‚Äôm using is also helping my skin on a daily basis rather than clogging it. My skin has never felt better.

reviews.review_text: I finally found a foundation that is the perfect color to my skin tone and leaves a healthy glow on the skin. It reduces the redness in my skin and just makes my skin even overall. This is a beautiful medium coverage foundation that blends easy and effortlessly. I have combo skin and was a bit skeptical in trying it but it sits beautifully on my skin and looks really natural without becoming cakey even when adding setting powder on top. One-two pumps is enough to cover my entire face and use a Beautyblender to blend it out. Truly a foundation I will be repurchasing. I was gifted this by Haus Labs.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I received this item in exchange for a review. I wanted to love this product so much, however it didn‚Äôt work for me as well as others, which happens. I still believe the product is worth continuing to test to see if I can find the right process for me. That said, I tried multiple ways of applying and finishing it as I could to see if it fell on my application or skin versus the actual product. I tried countless combinations starting with applying with a sponge vs brush, multiple types of primers vs no primer, using concealer under the product, over the product, and both, as well as trying a finishing spray vs. powder vs both. Some observations I made were that it worked well with a powder or both, so I may have to try it with the blurring loose setting powder for optimal results. Also, the consistency of the foundation is very liquidy so a little goes a long way. One pump was all I needed to cover my face whereas I typically need 2 ¬Ω to 3 pumps (so more bang for your buck). The texture is gentle and very soft and glides across the face easily. It doesn‚Äôt clump or feel suffocating on the face. I would say it works way better with a brush over a sponge (and if the foundation brush is anything like the concealer one, I need to get it). It does take a moment to dry down but that‚Äôs neither a pro or con for me. Additionally, if you have sensitive skin this is worth looking into. I didn‚Äôt have any reaction (redness or zits) after testing. Lastly one thing that sets this item apart and is a major pro for this product is the color match. I used the Haus Labs Shade Finder and it worked wonderfully. I truly was surprised at how well it matched to my skin. So, if you‚Äôre thinking about trying this product, I would definitely say give it a try and experiment with the application process. Make-up should be fun! üòä

reviews.review_text: after waiting & waiting to buy this, I finally gave in. If you‚Äôre wondering whether or not to buy this v expensive foundation, consider the pros and cons. It‚Äôs THICK‚Ä¶. It may feel weightless if you use one layer and don‚Äôt but up, but bc it‚Äôs so thick, going in for more coverage just lifts the first layer.  I hope my experience helps you in your decision because nobody wants to spend that much money on something they can‚Äôt use!

reviews.review_text: This foundation is absolutely incredible. I have combination, mature, acne prone, and aging skin.  I have a lot of things going on, so it‚Äôs very difficult to find a foundation. reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I like this product. It isn't perfect, but with prep (i.e. moisturizer/ primer), it is wonderful. The most important, amazing feature that shouldn't be ignored is what it does to your skin. I have very fair skin with rosacea, and finding a color match is tough. I have used Lancome' Teint idole sticks in beige ivory (210) for years. It is a perfect match. However, I am now 43, and it doesn't set on my skin as flawlessly as it once did...my pores are getting larger, and that is just life. I got a color match at the store, and it matched my neck, but I looked like a corpse and went up one level with something a bit more golden. It isn't perfect at first but settles nicely. But what is most shocking is that my rosacea is almost gone. I have tried everything to treat it, and after using this the past couple of months, my skin is glowing. It is the only thing I have changed. My teenage son told me I looked younger, and I was barefaced. I think the dark circles under my eyes have faded, and the skin around my eyes looks less puffy. so, sure, the color is a teensy bit less than perfect, but it had made my skin look amazing. I did NOT expect that at all. I should give it a 4.5 because of the color, but the magic it did to my skin makes it deserve a 5. I guess it is the niacinamide? I also found that coverage was better when I applied with my hands and not an applicator.

reviews.review_text: I used the shade finder quiz on the Haus Labs website & think this foundation is the closest I've ever got to my skin tone. It's definitely buildable/medium coverage (see 1 pump picture vs 2 pumps picture), brightens & evens skin tone (see the before & after of the pimple at the top of my forehead), & has longwear performance (wore it out to dinner & lasted me all evening). Disclosure: I was gifted this product by Haus Labs for my honest & genuine review.

It's a little tacky for the first couple minutes, similar to a tinted moisturizer, but it settles into a nice satin finish. The product is on the runnier side but not so much so that it's messy. I use my ULTA foundation blending bush. 4 stars just because I think there should be slightly more product for the price.  *** this particular combo included: - Rare Beauty Illuminating Primer - Rare Beauty undereye brightener - JS Cremated Palette - E.L.F halo cream countour - Bare minerals Mineral Veil - Rare Beauty illuminating setting mist

It was a very humid, summer evening and we‚Äôd been out on a restaurant porch and out for cocktails for 4-5 hours. I was impressed with how well it lasted without touch ups or setting powder ‚Äî I forgot it on vacation. With my Givenchy Prisme Libre 3 Viole Ros√©, all my fine lines around my eyes and mouth are completely blurred and the effect is gorgeous together. I‚Äôm curious to try the Haus Lab Setting Powder too, but now I‚Äôm happy using what I have and love. I highly recommend that you really prepare and prime your skin well; find your best shade; and using a setting powder you love to get the full effect. I love my faithful Dior foundation but this is the perfect summer foundation to stand up against the heat and humidity without the heaviness of a matte foundation. reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I typically have a hard time with foundations, because they are either too orange, heavy, or make me break out. This is the first foundation I've used where I am confident in the shade match and not worried that I'm going to have break outs when I remove it. It lasts all day, even on the days when I am in a rush and forget to apply primer. I have combo skin so super oily on my t-zone and dry every where else. I think the powder you choose with it matters A LOT. When I first started using it, I was using Laura Mercier and I was super oily by 10AM (2 hours after application). Now, I use the One-Size loose powder, and this combination is THE BEST. I start getting dewy around 2PM, but its a good dewy not dewy to where I look like I could use the oil to fry a chicken on a skillet. When I get out of work at 5:30pm my base still looks AMAZING.(I work inside,so I am not sure how it would last if I was always outside)  I think its also really important to ensure your skin is prepped well beforehand, because it'll allow the foundation to sit really beautifully. I also feel like this foundation has healed my skin in a way. Before I was always breaking out in rashes underneath my eyes and constantly had acne. Now, I have small hormonal breakouts here and there, but I haven't broken out into a rash under my eyes, and if I have a small breakout, after I wear the foundation, it has reduced or gone away. I am not sure how, but I swear it has healed my skin. The only thing about this foundation is that its medium coverage, so if you have really stubborn acne it will not cover it alone. However, I have lupus, rosacea, and acne-prone skin so my face is naturally always red, and this foundation covers the redness completely compared to a skin tint that will not cover it at all. I also never leave reviews, but I really love this foundation so much, and I hope it can help someone else like me with similar skin conditions.

I applied with a damp beauty blender and it made my skin gorgeous and dewy without being too slippy. The coverage is perfect for me, and actually buildable unlike most. 1 layer gives you slightly more coverage than a skin tint. 2 layers is more medium to full coverage. Super extra bonus that this has calming skincare ingredients as well. Seriously if you have rosacea or dryness or both go buy this right now before I propose and take it off the market.

reviews.review_title: I really didn't want to like this foundation...
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I was running out of my all time favorite Clinique Foundation that I have been using for years.  I wanted to try something new.  I was finding that the color wasn't matching my skin tone anymore; so I decided to try something new.  I wanted something lightweight, a little coverage, and that it looks natural.  Jahala at my local Sephora matched me with the 230.  I couldn't believe how natural it looks. I was extremely surprised that this foundation didn't oxidize either, which most foundation do that one me, which is why I stuck with one for so long.  I just wanted to write a review, because if you are in your 40s, with extreme combination skin, and are looking for a natural finish, lightweight foundation with a medium coverage, that won't budge on extreme heat and humidity look no further, because this one is it.  Once you set it with your favorite setting powder, it doesn't go anywhere.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This foundation is everything it needed to be! What a great first offering from Haus Labs. They kind of released this in the middle of the skin tint range which was a gamble but I‚Äôm glad it seems to have attracted the audience it deserves.   I‚Äôm a sheer-low medium coverage fan and prefer thinner serum like textures to whips, mousses and creams. I prefer to apply base products with a brush and a beauty sponge and I like being left with a satin finish. This product delivers on all of that. This is truly a high performing foundation worthy of the price tag. It has performed well with anything I‚Äôve paired it with and layers up beautifully without a trace of heaviness.   I can see this working for most skin types. I think the oiliest of skins should probably opt for something else since the finish is satin right from the start and the formula itself is quite hydrating. The shade selection is wonderful, any shade I‚Äôve swatched in-store has looked natural. This is one where you‚Äôre likely not going to want to blind buy as the descriptions are old-school in the way that MAC is. I normally wouldn‚Äôt opt for something with ‚Äúpeach‚Äù in the description but the shade works well.    I would highly recommend this and this is one of the best launches in recent memory.

If I were to recommend this to someone I would tell them that they use a different color wheel for their product descriptions which means warm toned means cool and cool toned means warm. That and while doing research on this product some people were mentioning allergic reactions to arnica which belongs to the ragweed allergy family so beware if you are.

I wouldn't have blind bought 040 Fair Neutral online just because of how PINK it looks, even with different screen settings. I ended up swatching it in-store and it definitely came out slightly more yellow and appears to be a spot-on match. Once again, the formula itself lives up to the hype, but do not trust the colors as they appear on the site. You definitely need to test these shades in store before you buy.  Even holding my bottle up to the image, I can see a stark difference. It is definitely more yellow than porcelain IRL.
