reviews.review_title: THE BEST BUT - with a long list of caveats
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I couldn't figure out why this was so polarizing - people absolutely LOVE it or it's the worst foundation ever.  But now that I've used it for a few weeks, I understand why.  It wins the Oscar for best Special effects and Best Actress but it doesn't win for Best Picture overall: - If you have normal or combo skin it will be beautiful on.  Skin-like and dewy perfection BUT I can see that this would be a mess on oily skin and it does cling to dry patches.  - If you have textured skin this probably isn't for you because it kind of emphasizes texture because of the 'glow factor'.   - It's tricky to set - the beauty of this product is in just application of the product itself, so if you use a setting powder, it takes away the finish, which is the whole point of this product. To prevent it from settling into creases, I now go in to the sides of my nose and around my mouth with a small feathery brush with the lightest setting powder imaginable, instead of a big pouffy brush like before. Tedious. -If you have discoloration (like a scar or a vein) this doesn't give the coverage you'll need and IT'S NOT BUILDABLE so you'll have to go in with concealer.  Fine if it's one or two spots, but time consuming and defeats the purpose if more than that. - It lasts pretty but not as long as others.  Overall I personally love this foundation, the finish is extraordinary, but it's as if this foundation works best on people who don't really need to wear foundation, lol.  Any issues at all turns this foundation into a labor of extra steps to making it work.  I bought this in 160 and normally use Estee Lauder Double wear in 2W2 Rattan, and the color is spot on.  However, double wear is a more user-friendly, universal problem solver as far as foundations go.  I will buy Haus Labs again because the finish is the VERY best I've ever put on, but I may also keep a spare bottle of double wear handy for when I'm in a rush or for the times my skin is acting up.

I bought the Haus Labs bronzer as well, and it is so nice with so many shades!  It feels like skincare.  Highly recommend.

Joking aside, I love the blurring and brightening, it‚Äôs texture is far better than any other serum foundation I‚Äôve tried. The only thing I don‚Äôt love is that it doesn‚Äôt seem like it ever fully sets. I haven‚Äôt tried it with the full powder  and setting mist routine, so I‚Äôll see how that treats me next.   Tl;dr: The best serum foundation I‚Äôve tried yet, but still not *quite* perfection. I wish I could give it a 4.5 ‚≠êÔ∏è rating.

Once I figured out the right products to layer underneath it looked beautiful initially. However, if you have oily skin, beware. It does not last long. I would say it looks great for maybe 2 hours max before my skin gets beyond oily (even after setting with powder and setting spray), starts separating and it starts to oxidize. I rarely reach for this foundation and it‚Äôs such a shame because I am past the return window.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brunette hair, Fair skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I *really* tried hard to incorporate this foundation into my everyday routine, but it just doesn't work for me.  I wear a mask at work all day, and after 10 minutes of wearing one, a lot of the foundation has been wiped off. As a result, it looks like it has settled unevenly across my skin. I gave it plenty of chances, using it over sunscreen and/or moisturizer, on a bare face, with a primer, without a primer, different brands and different types of primers (including a water-based one, thinking I was possibly incorrect to believe this was silicone-based foundation), applying it with my fingers, with a damp, then a dry blending sponge, with a make-up brush, and both with and without setting powder and sprays...it all revealed the same disappointing result.  I gave it every opportunity because I love(!!) the way it looks when I first put it on; their claims of skin-like is bang on, and it has decent coverage (even for someone with a frustrating combination of sun damage/dark spots and active, red breakouts).  While I will keep it as my special occasion foundation, this is likely not a re-purchase for me.

reviews.review_text: I've been using this for about 3 weeks now and I have to say I love it. It does take a while to figure out how to apply. At first I used to much and forgot to shake it (YOU NEED TO SHAKE IT) I tried a few different brushes as well and found that a fluffy powder brush actually worked WAY better than a foundation brush. I use one pump on my entire face. I also had to find skincare that worked with the foundation. Clinique 72 hr moisturizer did not work out well nor did the Glow Recipe toner. It dries pretty fast and looks like skin. I have rosacea and mature skin (35) and it covers it without feeling over done and fake. I don't set it with anything right now and it looks the same at the end of the day - even wear it to the gym after work and looks amazing. Highly recommend going to the store to get a shade match because the online shade finder was WAY off even Haus labs website wasn't right. Gave it 1 less star just for the amount of time it took me to figure out how to use the foundation.

Both a damp beauty sponge and setting spray separates it. I also have to it use it very sparingly around a deeper forehead line because it‚Äôll very noticeably settle. (I don‚Äôt have any other issues with it doing that in other fine lines though.) If you don‚Äôt have the patience to figure out what works best on your skin, then this product isn‚Äôt for you. I‚Äôd have given it several less stars if I hadn‚Äôt figured out what works for me when I did.

reviews.review_title: They have cool and warm backwards
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Coverage and finish is nice, but I find it really annoying that they've reversed cool and warm. Cool undertone is rosy/pink, warm undertone is yellow/golden, this is a standard in colour theory. I'm neutral leaning towards warm and and the 070 is too pinky cool for me. In looking at the other options, 030 might work as it's more warm yellow but is described as having a cool golden undertone. That is a contradiction, gold is not cool! Maybe it annoys me more than it should but these things are standardized for a reason.

reviews.review_title: A Very Two Way Street Type Of Product..
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I've been using this for almost a month now, & this is what I think of it.  Pro's:  1.) Looks like skin  2.) Feels like nothing is on 3.) Isn't heavy/Airy feel. 4.) Sticks to my skin like glue  Cons:  1.) Complicated shade range (warm is cool, cool is warm, & neutral is yellow)  2.) Not as hypoallergenic as to be believed (broke me out instantly however not in a painful way)  3.) Expensive  Now, although I like this foundation, the shade that I had help with finding, was completely off course. Neutral is too yellow. The whole finding your right shade is anxiety driven, & frustrating. My skin isn't used to wearing complexion products, so although it broke me out I'm not going to drive the nail through the coffin for just that. It could be just my skin getting used to something new on my face. However, if you have sensitive skin be cautious, as all people with sensitivity are different. The shade range & price is the main reason why a star is knocked off, as foundation shades should be more reasonably easy to find, & not complicated when there's already enough of that with other brands. So that was disappointing. However, I did enjoy how it felt on my face, but I am going to need to buy like 3-4 more shades to experiment with in order to find the right one eventually. This is a very expensive foundation as well, so at the end of the day, it's up to you whether it is worth it or not. Me personally, I wouldn't mind buying this again, but I wouldn't buy it all the time though. Don't completely love it, but I certainly don't hate it. It's a balanced likable product.

After a few more days, another massive breakout. I‚Äôm taking 15-20 zits on someone who maybe gets a pimple or two a year. reviews.review_text: I have no idea where people are getting a matte finish from this foundation. for me, this leaves my skin looking glowy, dewy, even, and skin-like. I am so obsessed with this foundation, I can't even explain it, but I will try.   upon first application I worried it ran a touch too yellow, but then I realized throughout the day that it was actually a perfect match. It seemed as though it was going to be anything but transfer proof when I first applied it, because it did feel so moisturizing and wet. there is a dry down for it and what it is dried down, honey, it does not budge! I never feel throughout the day like I have product on my face.   the skin care ingredients are moisturizing and my skin feels great! I used to use the Fenty ease drops for my daily foundation but it transferred all over the place and was far too matte and drying for the winter.   I've never had an easier time blending a foundation before this one and the finish it has on the skin is exceptional. It doesn't look like you're wearing anything at all. The coverage is medium to light and it easily covers redness without leaving that full coverage look. I don't think I'll ever use anything else ever again!

She explained the ingredients are clean and that this foundation is super popular right now. This foundation feels lightweight, covers my acne, and is moisturizing but doesn't make me look oily. I have extremely dry skin but I don't find that it clings to my dry spots (which I do currently have). Come into Sephora to get your shade matched because it is genuinely so difficult to get a shade match online. Also, I feel like the undertones for these foundations are more yellow but it blends in with my skin after applying even if it looks yellow at first? It hasn't made me break out and I have extremely sensitive skin and have been wearing it for a couple of days now. All in all, I do recommend this foundation if you are looking for a nice quality, good coverage and moisturizing foundation. I work long 8 hour shifts and it stays on all day after setting. The foundation bottle is really nice and a small amount of product covers a good amount of my face. It is definitely worth the price ( at least for me).

I honestly can't speak on whatever Arnica technology this claims to have because I'm no scientist but I CAN tell you that when I have pimples this seems to calm them down and make them improve!  The only cons about this that I can find are that the shade range is super wonky (the neutrals lean pretty yellow and don't even get me started on the cool and warm stuff) and this does transfer a bit if you don't set it. Take your time picking out your correct shade, set it lightly with a powder you trust and it'll be your new best friend.   10/10 never buying another foundation again.

reviews.review_text: I had high hopes for this foundation based on social media influence and the ingredients. And I have other Haus Labs cosmetics that I do love! Pro: It goes on nice and blends seamlessly with your skin initially. The online shade description was highly accurate. Cons: It separates throughout the day and highlights pores. For me it also caused a strange allergic reaction where my eyes became red and watery (I did not get in in my eyes).
